p: H9N2 viruses have been isolated from poultry in the USA periodically throughout the second half of the twentieth Century, in fact the prototypic H9N2 isolate (A/turkey/Wisconsin/1/1966) was isolated in this period. All isolated viruses have been of the American lineage and appear to be spillover events from wild birds, possibly sea birds which carry genetically closely related viruses in this region. Since 2001, there has been no evidence of the virus in poultry in North America, despite routine surveillance and extensive evidence of other non-H9N2 viruses in poultry [ 64, 65, 66, 67, 68].
